[[File:The Lord of the Rings Online - North Undeep.jpg|thumb|250px|North Undeep in ''[[The Lord of the Rings Online]]'']]
{{main|Undeeps}}
The '''North Undeep''' was one of two westward bends of the river [[Anduin]] located between [[The Wold]] and the [[Brown Lands]] (the other being the [[South Undeep]]).  The upper part of the North Undeep also bordered the [[Field of Celebrant]] and was where the river [[Limlight]] joined the Great River.<ref>{{UT|Map}}</ref>  Both of the Undeeps had many shallows and wide shoals that afforded an easy crossing for armies,<ref>{{UT|6c}}</ref> which occurred a number of times during the history of [[Gondor]] and [[Rohan]].

==Portrayal in adaptations==
'''2012: ''[[The Lord of the Rings Online]]'':'''
:The North Undeep is located north of the river [[Limlight]] and thus belongs to the in-game "Great River" region, outside of Rohan proper. It does not connect the [[Brown Lands]] to the [[Field of Celebrant]] directly, but rather to the ''Rushgore'' marsh that lies in between them. The Rohirrim have constructed and manned a fortified camp of ''Etheburg'' on the eastern bank of Anduin in the Brown Lands to watch over the North Undeep.
